utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Why are you up?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: How am I supposed to sleep? I’ve been married less than 24 hours, and my wife isn’t speaking to me.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Perhaps you can think of this n a more positive light. In one day, you’ve managed to do what it takes many couples decades to achieve.

utterance.speaker: Penny (entering)
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You couldn’t sleep either?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Of course not.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Me neither. But I just had a tickle in my throat, not profound marital problems.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What are we gonna do?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I don’t know.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Please, tell me how I can fix it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Glad you asked. As I see it, there’s a simple solution. Your lips had a dalliance with the lips of another woman. It seems only logical that to restore balance to the relationship, you should find another man and dally with him. And by dally, I mean some hardcore mouth-on-mouth action.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay, that is the stupidest thing I’ve ever heard.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Actually, I think he’s onto something.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You can’t be serious. ‘Cause I messed up and made out with a girl, you’re gonna do the same with a random guy?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m currently single.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: That’s true. You are.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What is happening?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I will tell you what is happening. I am saving my best friend’s marriage.

utterance.speaker: Leonard (waking up)
utterance.content: U-u-u-uh!

utterance.speaker: Amy (on skype)
utterance.content: Sheldon, I don’t think you understand how being broken up works. The only way I can sort through my feelings is if there is space between us. Every time I see you, it re-traumatizes me. I go through the pain all over again.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, hello to you, too.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: What do you want?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I understand we’re no longer a couple, but I would like to remind you that we made a baby together.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: What baby?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: A precocious little Internet show known as Fun With Flags.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I’m hanging up.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Great. See you in about half an hour.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Sheldon, I am not doing Fun With Flags with you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Why not?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Because we’re broken up.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Sonny and Cher made it work. Their variety show kept going long after the divorce, and here we are still talking about them.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: No one’s talking about Sonny and Cher.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You must be thinking about Donny and Marie, ’cause you and I are clearly talking about Sonny and Cher.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Sheldon, this has to stop. I know it’s hard. It’s hard for me, too. But I’ve seen and talked to you more in the two days we’ve been broken up than in the last two months that we were together.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, if you want to see less of me, maybe we should go out again.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I can’t believe you made out with Mandy Chao.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, trust me, I wish it never happened.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: And you knew about this this whole time?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I did.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: And you didn’t think to tell me?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Leonard asked me to keep it to myself.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Let’s leave Leonard out of this for the moment. This is about you and me.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Wait, wait, wait, how is my day-old marriage falling apart becoming about you two?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hang on. What do I need to do to make you trust me?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You think it’s hard having one wife, try having two.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I bet you told Bernadette all about how he was screwing around with Mandy Chao.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, we didn’t screw around. We just got drunk and made out.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Whatever. It would have been nice to hear it from you.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: What are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m here to return your belongings. That’s what people who’ve broken up do.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: And you didn’t do your compulsive knocking ritual so I would open the door.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: On the contrary, you no longer get to enjoy my charming eccentricities. We’re not friends with benefits.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Just give me the box.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Wait. Don’t you want to go through it to make sure I haven’t forgotten anything?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Fine. My old scarf.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You wore it the night we went ice-skating. Remember?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You mean the night that I went ice-skating, and you stood at the rail googling the symptoms of hypothermia?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: We made one heck of a team, huh?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Whose bra is this?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s not yours? Oh, my. How embarrassing for both of us.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: It’s Penny’s.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hey, you broke up with me. It is none of your business whose naked bosom I’m smooshing around like pizza dough.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Good-bye.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Amy. Amy. Amy. Hmm. Tables work, too. Good to know.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Ooh, brownies for girls’ night!

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Hands off. I’m mad at you.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Look, I know it’s a lot of money, but the guy at the store said in five to seven years, it’ll pay for itself.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: What will pay for itself?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Doesn’t matter. What are you mad about?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I’m mad at you for blabbing to me what Leonard did on the North Sea, and I’m mad that I’ve had to hide this from Penny for two years.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: And you have every right to be mad about those things. So, why don’t you let me handle the credit card bill this month, huh? I mean, don’t even look at it.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I mean, if Penny finds out I’ve known all this time and haven’t told her, she’s gonna think I’m a terrible friend. I wish you never told me.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: And I wish Leonard never told me. He’s the bad guy here.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I guess that’s true.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: And you let Penny marry him. Compared to that, who cares if I bought a George Clooney limited edition manscaping kit?

utterance.speaker: Leonard (on phone)
utterance.content: Hi. I’m calling about your marriage counselling services and was curious what your rate is. Really? Um, okay. Is there any kind of discount for length of marriage? ‘Cause we’re just talking hours here.

utterance.speaker: Penny (entering)
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Call you back. Hey.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Can we talk?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I would love that.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: All right, look, I’m sorry I said I was okay with everything before we got married. I hate that we’re going through this, but I don’t know what to do.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: If you don’t mind waiting for a Groupon, we can try marriage counselling.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (entering)
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey, uh, buddy, can we have some privacy?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, of course. Wouldn’t want to intrude. This is yours.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, when I’m done with him, I’m gonna need more information.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Nothing odd. I just wanted to rub Amy’s nose in it.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, look, I might be overreacting, but how am I supposed to get past this when I know tomorrow you’re gonna go to work and see this woman?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Now, forgive me for eavesdropping, but as I see it, there’s a simple solution.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Wake up, wake up, wake up.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Bring Penny to meet Mandy.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What? Why?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, right now, Penny’s imagination is running wild, but if they meet, that will eliminate the mystery and alleviate her fears. Like when that Sparkletts guy let me look under his eye patch.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Uh, first of all, you made that guy cry.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: And we learned that you don’t need an eyeball to do that.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Secondly, I can’t think of a more horrible idea than Penny meeting Mandy.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Really? Why is that?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What, you actually want to meet her?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No, but now that you’re being weird about it, maybe I should.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m not being weird. Am I being weird?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes. And that’s coming from me.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Fine, you want to meet her?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No, I just want to know that when you’re at work, there’s nothing going on.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: How many times do I have to tell you? I have no interest in this woman.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, well, maybe she has interest in you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: In Leonard? Oh, even the Sparkletts guy could see that’s unlikely.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I guess my big problem is I never saw Leonard as the kind of guy who would do something like this.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Anybody can make a mistake in a weak moment.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What do you think?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I don’t know what to think. But then again, I just found out about it.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You know, I fell in love with Leonard because he wasn’t anything like the guys I was used to dating. I mean, I knew those guys weren’t above cheating because that’s usually how we met.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Come on, you know Leonard’s not like that.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I want to believe you. I really do. Am I being naive?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Oh, I don’t know. This is all so new to me. I’m still processing.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You know, he never would’ve done this when we first met. He’s cockier now.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: That’s because you made him more confident.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: You know, if you think about it, without you, he never would’ve grown into the person he is now. I mean, sure, more women might notice him, but I think it’s better to have a guy be with you because he wants to be and not because he thinks he doesn’t have any other choice.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I never thought about it like that.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Oh, me neither, not until just now.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hello. I’m Dr. Sheldon Cooper, and welcome to Sheldon Cooper Presents: Fun With Flags. You may notice that I’m holding a remote control. That’s because my cameraperson and co-host, Dr. Amy Farrah Fowler, has chosen to end her relationship with me. I’m going to pause here to let that sink in. Okay. If you need to pause a little longer, just click the pause button. But the show must go on. And thankfully, all the things my girlfriend used to do can be taken care of with my right hand. Anyway, let’s not spend any more time talking about her. We’re here to talk about flags. Tonight’s theme, flags of countries that have been torn apart and the women I have a feeling were responsible.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You guys have any idea how much it costs to see a marriage counsellor?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: 250 dollars an hour. Why?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: How do you know?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Bernadette and I have occasionally gone to one to, you know, stay on top of things.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: And I’m just hearing about this now?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Dude, just because we’re best friends doesn’t mean that I have to tell you everything that goes on.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You don’t have to, you should want to.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, great, there’s Mandy.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Why are marine biologists always so cute?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I don’t know, but I’d like to get lost in her Bermuda Triangle.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That’s not helpful.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Then I won’t say I’d like to cover three-quarters of her surface area.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Are we done?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Not yet, this is fun. Ooh, I know. I’d let her free my willy. Where you going?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m gonna ask her if she’d be willing to talk to Penny, tell her she has nothing to worry about.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Leonard, wait.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’d like to SpongeBob her SquarePants.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Now we are done.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Mandy
utterance.content: Oh, hi, Leonard. What’s up?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Uh, do you mind if I sit?

utterance.speaker: Mandy
utterance.content: Sure.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: So, um, I’ve been thinking a lot about you and me and the boat.

utterance.speaker: Mandy
utterance.content: What about it?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You know, what we did, when we were drunk.

utterance.speaker: Mandy
utterance.content: Oh, no, did I sleep with you, too?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, we just made out.

utterance.speaker: Mandy
utterance.content: Oh. Well, good for me. So what can I do for you?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Uh, okay, well, um, I got married recently.

utterance.speaker: Mandy
utterance.content: Oh, congratulations. To Sheldon?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Never gets old. No, no, to a girl. Anyway, I told her what happened between you and me, and she’s concerned about us seeing each other at work.

utterance.speaker: Mandy
utterance.content: It was just a kiss. Why would you even tell her?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Because I didn’t want there to be any secrets between us.

utterance.speaker: Mandy
utterance.content: Is that really the reason?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What else would it be?

utterance.speaker: Mandy
utterance.content: I don’t know. Sounds like you’re trying to sabotage the relationship.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, I don’t think so. Although, Penny did say exactly that.

utterance.speaker: Mandy
utterance.content: Okay, well, that’s something to think about.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You know, on some level, I’ve always believed that I don’t deserve a woman like her.

utterance.speaker: Mandy
utterance.content: Oh, you’re gonna think about that right here?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I mean, she’s really beautiful. She could have any guy she wants. Which is probably why it took her so many years to tell me she loved me.

utterance.speaker: Mandy
utterance.content: Maybe you should talk to a therapist about this.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Too expensive. You’d think I’d be used to women withholding their love. I mean, my mother did. I mean, no matter how hard I tried, she just didn’t have any interest in me.

utterance.speaker: Mandy
utterance.content: Imagine that.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I wonder if that’s why I have such a dysfunctional relationship with Sheldon. I had a dream the other night that I was in a cave and I was nursing a baby, but the baby had Sheldon’s head on it.

utterance.speaker: Mandy
utterance.content: And your wife is worried about me?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hey, Leonard, when you’re done, we came up with a bunch more.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (on screen)
utterance.content: And then the Czech Republic says to Slovakia, I don’t think you understand how being broken up works. Can you believe that? You’d think that the Czech Republic would try to hold on to what it had, given that it’s not as young as it used to be. And I don’t see any other countries lining up to invade its southern borders.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I’m gonna kill him.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: But enough about the Czech Republic. Let’s talk about the time Moldova made Romania a birthday cake and Romania said it tasted good even though it didn’t. And yet Romania gets dumped. I’ll pause here while you mull that one over. I know, right?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: So, you said you had something to tell me.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay, yeah, um, do you remember when you accused me of trying to sabotage our wedding?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Uh-huh.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’ve been thinking about it, and you might be right. But the good news is that I’m pretty sure I know why.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I’m listening.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Penny, after all these years, I still feel like maybe I don’t deserve you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, that is the lamest excuse you could’ve possibly come up with. But I get it.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You do?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah. Yeah, sometimes I worry you’re gonna wake up and leave me for someone more like you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I don’t even understand why you’re with someone like me. Why would I want to be with someone like me?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You know what I mean. And, you know, maybe the way I’ve been reacting was me sabotaging this, too.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, how about we stop being so scared of losing each other and just be together?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: That sounds nice.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Good. Because I’ve loved you since the moment we met, and I will keep loving you until the end of time.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh. Oh, my God, that is the most beautiful thing anyone’s ever said to me.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah? That’s because you’re beautiful, and your beauty fills my heart with love and song.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: It’s getting kind of cheesy, Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Huh? If you think that’s cheesy, buckle up. Penny Hofstadter, will you please stay married to me?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, damn it, you topped it. Should we go to the bedroom and make this marriage official?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yes, please.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sheldon, I can’t believe you got us a wedding gift.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I don’t know why you’re so surprised. I watch movies, I see what people do.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What is this?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Plane tickets and hotel reservations for a weekend away in San Francisco.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Wow.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: That’s so great.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah, there’s Fisherman’s Wharf and Alcatraz and cable cars. We’re gonna have so much fun.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: We?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Is there a problem?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, no, no, I just, I said, Whee.

utterance.speaker: Amy (at door)
utterance.content: How dare you go on the Internet and say mean things about me and compare my genitalia to part of Czechoslovakia?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You saw through that one, did you?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I don’t know what you were thinking, but take the video down now.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: She watched it. I’m gonna get that girl back.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I only watched it because you e-mailed it to me with the subject line this is gonna make you mad.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: She was listening through the door. She wants me.
